ListallOrganizations.name: List all Organizations
ListallOrganizations.description: Returns all organizations within the current caller's scope

display_name.title: display_name
display_name.description: Name of the site to be used for display throughout the site (other than formal functions such as printed patient records)

site_name.title: site_name
site_name.description: Name of the site to be used in xyz way

formal_name.title: formal_name
formal_name.description: Name of the site to be used in xyz way

domain.title: domain
domain.description: Determines the URL this organization runs under (e.g. a value of 'client1' would make this org available under client1.aristamd.com)

namespace.title: namespace
namespace.description: Specifies a namespace for code customization

display_name.title: display_name
display_name.description: Name of the site to be used for display throughout the site (other than formal functions such as printed patient records)

site_name.title: site_name
site_name.description: Name of the site to be used in xyz way

formal_name.title: formal_name
formal_name.description: Name of the site to be used in xyz way

domain.title: domain
domain.description: Determines the URL this organization runs under (e.g. a value of 'client1' would make this org available under client1.aristamd.com)

namespace.title: namespace
namespace.description: Specifies a namespace for code customization

GetOrganizationpopulationhistory.name: Get Organization population history
GetOrganizationpopulationhistory.description: Get the average daily population of an organization

ListRoles.name: List Roles
ListRoles.description: Get a list of all roles that have been created. Please note roles scoped and are organization dependent. This means that one set of roles may be entirely different that another set of roles based on the credentials of the caller.

ListallUsers.name: List all Users
ListallUsers.description: List all users in an organization

searchValue.title: searchValue
searchValue.description: Limit the result set to the term specified. The term will be matched against the following user attributes: last_name, first_name, site, role, and status

searchStatus.title: searchStatus
searchStatus.description: Limit the result set to users with the given status

start.title: start
start.description: Used when paging the results. This will start the results offset by this amount

len.title: len
len.description: Used when paging the results. This will limit the total results to the number specified

orderColumn.title: orderColumn
orderColumn.description: Column to order the results by. Results are ordered by last_name by default. Valid options are last_name, first_name, site, role, and status.

orderDir.title: orderDir
orderDir.description: Direction to order the result set. Results are ordered in ascending order by default. Valid options are asc and desc.

GetUser.name: Get User
GetUser.description: Get the details of a single users

user_id.title: user_id
user_id.description: User Id in the form of an integer or UUID.

CreateUser.name: Create User
CreateUser.description: Create a new user. By default when a new user is created their status is 'invited' and they are sent a welcome email which contains a one-time use password which expires in 24 hours. Once the user logs in with the provided credentials their status is changed to active.

username.title: username
username.description: Unique user identifier. This may be their email address or another unique string

email.title: email
email.description: The user's email address. Please note that we do not send any ePHI over email.

mobile.title: mobile
mobile.description: Mobile phone number of the user

suffix.title: suffix
suffix.description: Academic degree or credential abbreviation such as MD, RN, etc...

role.title: role
role.description: The role (such as admin or approves, etc...) which this user is assigned. To get a list of roles please see the Roles resource

organizations.title: organizations
organizations.description: Array of organizations to which this user should be assigned.

user_id.title: user_id
user_id.description: User Id in the form of an integer or UUID

username.title: username
username.description: Unique user identifier. This may be their email address or another unique string

email.title: email
email.description: The user's email address. Please note that we do not send any ePHI over email.

mobile.title: mobile
mobile.description: Mobile phone number of the user

status.title: status
status.description: Update the status of a user. Valid statuses include active, inactive, suspended, reset_password

suffix.title: suffix
suffix.description: Academic degree or credential abbreviation such as MD, RN, etc...

role.title: role
role.description: The role (such as admin or approves, etc...) which this user is assigned. To get a list of roles please see the Roles resource

organizations.title: organizations
organizations.description: Array of organizations to which this user should be assigned.

ListPermissions.name: List Permissions
ListPermissions.description: List all the permissions granted to the specified user

CheckPermission.name: Check Permission
CheckPermission.description: Check if a given user has a specific permission

permission.title: permission
permission.description: Permission code such as create_site or patient_update, etc... for a full list of permissions please see the List Permissions method

ListallClinicalIssues.name: List all Clinical Issues
ListallClinicalIssues.description: Display a list of all the clinical issues matching given criteria

term.title: term
term.description: Search term to limit the result set by. The term must be at least 3 characters in length

offset.title: offset
offset.description: Offset the results starting at the point specified. Used when paging results.

limit.title: limit
limit.description: Limits the total results. Used when paging results.

code.title: code
code.description: Find the clinical issue matching the code specified

specialty_id.title: specialty_id
specialty_id.description: Specialty Id, for a list of specialty IDs please see the Specialty resource

ListallSpecialties.name: List all Specialties
ListallSpecialties.description: Get a list of all known specialties. This will consistent across all organizations

context.title: context
context.description: Different sets of specialties show up for different kinds of requests. One set for referrals, another for eConsults, etc...

ListOrganizationSpecialties.name: List Organization Specialties
ListOrganizationSpecialties.description: Get a list of all specialties assigned to the current user's organization

GetaPanelist.name: Get a Panelist
GetaPanelist.description: Returns panelist details including their availability, specialties, etc...

user_id.title: user_id
user_id.description: User Id in the form of an integer or UUID.

notes.title: notes
notes.description: A personal note that is presented to the primary care provider when he or she submits an eConsult to the panelist

profile_photo.title: profile_photo
profile_photo.description: URL to a photo of the panelist that is displayed throughout the application. To upload a photo please see the Assets endpoint

cv.title: cv
cv.description: An overview of a the panelist's experience and other qualifications.

date.title: date
date.description: Year the certification was granted, eg... 2001

name.title: name
name.description: Institution name which conferred the degree

degree.title: degree
degree.description: Class of degree such as MD, DO, PhD, etc...

date.title: date
date.description: Year the degree was granted, eg... 2001

fellowships.title: fellowships
fellowships.description: Where the panelist has trained after completing residency.

items.title: specialty_id
items.description: Id of a specialty in integer or UUID format

states.title: states
states.description: States in which this panelist is licensed to practice

items.title: state_id
items.description: ID of a state record in the AristaMD platform. For more details on states please see the States resource

main_practice_location.title: main_practice_location
main_practice_location.description: The medical institution(s) at which this panelist practices

GetPatient.name: Get Patient
GetPatient.description: Get the resource of Patient based on the patients ID.

patient_id.title: patient_id
patient_id.description: The id or UUID of the patient

CreatePatient.name: Create Patient
CreatePatient.description: Send this patient resource in order to create a new patient in the system.

reference_id.title: reference_id
reference_id.description: generic identifier for third-party.  Typically a patient ID from another system.

date_of_birth.title: date_of_birth
date_of_birth.description: Date of Birth of the patient. Format: 1954-05-09T06:00:00.000Z

booking_date.title: booking_date
booking_date.description: The date in which the patient was admitted. Format: 2015-11-09T06:00:00.000Z

items.title: chronic_condition
items.description: Add multiple chronic conditions to this array.

GetReferral.name: Get Referral
GetReferral.description: Get the resource of a referral based on the referrals id.

CreatenewReferral.name: Create new Referral
CreatenewReferral.description: Post action to create a new referral

requesting_physician.title: requesting_physician
requesting_physician.description: The physician that is requesting this referral.  Must be their user_id.

approver.title: approver
approver.description: The user onsite that approves this referral. Must be their user_id. Get a list of available users by role ''

request_date.title: request_date
request_date.description: The date that this referral is requested.  Often this is todays date. Format: 2015-01-13T15:52:50.205Z

service.title: service
service.description: The requested service for this referral.  Must use KEY: (IC=>Offsite Inpatient Care, ER=>Emergency, IO=>Offsite Imaging, OL=>Offsite Labs, OOD=>Offsite Other Diagnostics, OSV=>Offsite Specialist Visit, OS=>Outpatient Surgery, Other=>Other)

specialty.title: specialty
specialty.description:
Selected organization Specialty.
(addiction_medicine=>Addiction or Rehab, allergy_and_immunology=>Allergy and Immunology, cardiology=>Cardiology, clinical_cardiac_electrophysiology=>Clinical Cardiac Electrophysiology) Contact aristaMD for full list of specialties.

urgency.title: urgency
urgency.description: The urgency rating for this referral.  (Routine,Expedited,Urgent,Emergent)

transfer.title: transfer
transfer.description: Transfer Method. How is the person being transported to the referred physician.  (Ambulance, Air Ambulance, Onsite Service. No Transport)

category.title: category
category.description: The category ID. Typically the IC9 category code

comment.title: comment
comment.description: A general comment about this referral.

diagnosis.title: diagnosis
diagnosis.description: The diagnosis of the patient.  Is an object containing (code, display_name, parent_id)

display_name.title: display_name
display_name.description: The display name for the diagnosis sent over.

parent_id.title: parent_id
parent_id.description: Parent ID references the Category ID.

inmate.title: inmate
inmate.description: The corresponding patient that has been attached to this referral.

id.title: id
id.description: The existing patient ID pulled from a previous request to create a patient

booking_date.title: booking_date
booking_date.description: The date that the patient was entered into the system

estimated_release_date.title: estimated_release_date
estimated_release_date.description: The estimate of when this patient will be released finished and released from the facility.  Typically same day.

DispositionReferral.name: Disposition Referral
DispositionReferral.description: You can move the referral along the workflow by sending different status's. Status's include: info, approved_for_econsult, completed_scheduled,  approved, refused

status.title: status
status.description: Setting the status to for the Referral. use: info, approved_for_econsult, completed_scheduled,  approved, refused

requester_comment.title: requester_comment
requester_comment.description: Additional comment that will be attached to the referral.

ScheduleReferral.name: Schedule Referral
ScheduleReferral.description: Move the referral along the workflow. This will set the status to completed and scheduled

status.title: status
status.description: Setting the status to for the Referral to approved.

requester_comment.title: requester_comment
requester_comment.description: Additional comment that will be attached to the referral.

CreateEConsult.name: Create EConsult
CreateEConsult.description: If you want to create a new Electronic Consultation.

requesting_physician.title: requesting_physician
requesting_physician.description: The physician that is requesting this referral.  Must be their user_id.

request_date.title: request_date
request_date.description: The date that this referral is requested.  Often this is todays date. Format: 2015-01-13T15:52:50.205Z

specialty.title: specialty
specialty.description:
Selected organization Specialty.
(addiction_medicine=>Addiction or Rehab, allergy_and_immunology=>Allergy and Immunology, cardiology=>Cardiology, clinical_cardiac_electrophysiology=>Clinical Cardiac Electrophysiology) Contact aristaMD for full list of specialties.

category.title: category
category.description: The category ID. Typically the IC9 category code

main_question.title: main_question
main_question.description: The question that should be asked to the doctor about this patient

supporting_details.title: supporting_details
supporting_details.description: Details about the patient the are provided that support the question.

diagnosis.title: diagnosis
diagnosis.description: The diagnosis of the patient.  Is an object containing (code, display_name, parent_id)

display_name.title: display_name
display_name.description: The display name for the diagnosis sent over.

parent_id.title: parent_id
parent_id.description: Parent ID references the Category ID.

inmate.title: inmate
inmate.description: The corresponding patient that has been attached to this referral.

id.title: id
id.description: The existing patient ID pulled from a previous request to create a patient

booking_date.title: booking_date
booking_date.description: The date that the patient was entered into the system

estimated_release_date.title: estimated_release_date
estimated_release_date.description: The estimate of when this patient will be released finished and released from the facility.  Typically same day.

PanelistAnswerEconsult.name: Panelist Answer Econsult
PanelistAnswerEconsult.description: Our panelist can answer the question that was asked on the econsult with their action plans.  This method is that response acting as the panelist / specialist responding.

requesting_physician.title: requesting_physician
requesting_physician.description: The original requesting physician. Still need an ID.

status.title: status
status.description: The current status of the EConsult.  Status include (pending, saved, info, completed, follow_up)

supporting_details.title: supporting_details
supporting_details.description: This is the original supporting details from the request.

response_date.title: response_date
response_date.description: The date the panelist has responded to the EConsult.

request_date.title: request_date
request_date.description: The original request date from the primary care physician

panelist_status.title: panelist_status
panelist_status.description: The panelists response.  How the panelist fef  Follows: (consultation, info, switch, face_to_face, saved)

main_question.title: main_question
main_question.description: The main question that the panelist will respond to

diagnosis.title: diagnosis
diagnosis.description: The diagnosis of the patient.  Is an object containing (code, display_name, parent_id)

display_name.title: display_name
display_name.description: The display name for the diagnosis sent over.

parent_id.title: parent_id
parent_id.description: Parent ID references the Category ID.

answer.title: answer
answer.description: This is the answer that the panelist will return on the EConsult.

initials.title: initials
initials.description: The initials of the panelist who is attesting to this EConsult answer.

appropriateness.title: appropriateness
appropriateness.description: The appropriateness is how the panelist feels about the econsult. They can set to follow: (info, consultation, switch, face_to_face)

recommended_specialty.title: recommended_specialty
recommended_specialty.description: If the panelist decides this request needs to be switched to a different specialty, this is their recommendation. Ex. endocrinology
